is-resolvable

A Node module to check if a module ID is resolvable with require()

```javascript const isResolvable = require(‘is-resolvable’);

isResolvable(‘fs’); //=> true isResolvable(‘path’); //=> true

// When ./index.js exists isResolvable(‘./index.js’) //=> true isResolvable(‘./index’) //=> true isResolvable(‘.’) //=> true ```

Installation

Use npm.

npm install is-resolvable

API

javascript const isResolvable = require('is-resolvable');

isResolvable(moduleId)

moduleId: String (module ID)
Return: Boolean

It returns true if require() can load a file form a given module ID, otherwise false.

```javascript const isResolvable = require(‘is-resolvable’);

// When ./foo.json exists isResolvable(‘./foo.json’); //=> true isResolvable(‘./foo’); //=> true

isResolvable(‘./foo.js’); //=> false

// When lodash module is installed but underscore isn’t isResolvable(‘lodash’); //=> true isResolvable(‘underscore’); //=> false

// When readable-stream module is installed isResolvable(‘readable-stream/readable’); //=> true isResolvable(‘readable-stream/writable’); //=> true ```
